alert.note: Alert for Brazoria; Galveston (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 29 at 10:26PM CST until December 30 at 1:00AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Brazoria and Galveston. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over some roadways on Galveston Island. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1020 PM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated locally heavy rain due to training showers and thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. Law enforcement indicates no road closures at this time. Although the heaviest rains appear to be slowly moving out of the area, and standing water on roadways will be slow to recede. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... League City, Galveston Island West End, Galveston Causeway, Texas City, Dickinson, La Marque, Santa Fe, eastern Freeport, Hitchcock, Kemah, Surfside Beach, Galveston Pier 21, Bayou Vista, Oyster Creek, Clear Lake Shores, Jamaica Beach, Tiki Island, Galveston State Park, San Luis Pass and Scholes Field. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
